questions.question_text:
An administrator needs to perform maintenance on a datastore that is running the vSphere Cluster Services (vCLS) virtual machines (VMs).
Which feature can the administrator use in this scenario to avoid the use of Storage vMotion on the vCLS VMs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D of course

D is absolutely correct.
When a datastore is placed in maintenance mode, if the datastore hosts vCLS VMs, you must manually storage vMotion the vCLS VMs to a new location or put the cluster in retreat mode

questions.question_text:
A vSphere cluster has the following vSphere Distributed Resource Scheduler (DRS) group configuration:
Virtual machine (VM) group named DB
Host groups named PROD11 and PROD55
The administrator wants to force the VMs in the DB group to run on the hosts in the PROD11 group. However, if all the hosts in PROD11 go offline for maintenance, then the VMs in the DB group should run on hosts in PROD55.
Which VM/Host rule must the administrator create to ensure that these requirements are met?

choices.D: A required rule between the DB group and the PROD55 group
choices.A: A preferential rule between the DB group and the PROD11 group
choices.B: A preferential rule between the DB group and the PROD55 group
choices.C: A required rule between the DB group and the PROD11 group

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A: If you add a required rule, the VMs will only run on the specified cluster and cannot run anywhere else.

Selected Answer: A
To ensure that the VMs in the DB group run on the hosts in the PROD11 group but can run on hosts in the PROD55 group if all the hosts in PROD11 go offline, the administrator should create a rule that sets a preference rather than a strict requirement. This way, the VMs will prefer the PROD11 hosts but can fall back to the PROD55 hosts if necessary.

The correct rule to create is:

A. A preferential rule between the DB group and the PROD11 group

Should be A. Just keep in mind that using "should" is a safer setting as it allows the VMs to run on a different host for HA and maintenance reasons. Ref: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-0591F865-91B5-4311-ABA6-84FBA5AAFB59.html

Should be A according to the below

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/8.0/vsphere-resource-management/GUID-2FB90EF5-7733-4095-8B66-F10D6C57B820.html
Answer Would be A...

Selected Answer: A
... surely
Agree - Answer is A

comments.content: Wrong, if you do that, the VM cannot run on the other cluster; which is part of the requirements.

discussion.content: The correct answer is D. A required rule between the DB group and the PROD11 group.

Selected Answer: A
A preferential rule between the DB group and the PROD11 group. This is the only rule that accomplish them.
